intro: Senecio triligulatus var. foliatopedunculatus, commonly known as the leafy-stemmed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
